title: How to Dry Clean a Comforter at Home

steps.title: Buy a home dry cleaning kit.
steps.content: Buy a home dry cleaning kit. Look in the laundry section of your grocery or big-box store for a home dry cleaning kit. It should include the specially designed dry cleaning cloths, as well as a bag to put the items in. Some kits include stain pre-treating spray. Dryel, Bounce, and Woolite sell home dry cleaning kits. [1] X Research source This type of dry cleaning is used for freshening fabric and will not clean heavily soiled fabrics. If your comforter is in need of a thorough washing, you’ll need to do more than home dry cleaning.

steps.title: Treat stains before dry cleaning the comforter.
steps.content: Treat stains before dry cleaning the comforter. Most dry cleaning kits are not made to wash away bad stains. Treat bad stains with a basic enzyme cleaner, like Shout or Spray-N-Wash, or use another stain treatment option, like vinegar or meat tenderizer. If the dry cleaning kit provides a stain treater, use it.

steps.title: Put the comforter in the bag provided in the kit.
steps.content: Put the comforter in the bag provided in the kit. Open up the dry cleaning bag that came with the kit. Stuff the comforter into the bag, making sure it is not folded up. If the comforter seems to fit too tightly in the bag, put the comforter directly into the dryer and clean it without the bag.

steps.title: Add one of the dry cleaning clothes to the bag with the comforter.
steps.content: Add one of the dry cleaning clothes to the bag with the comforter. Take one of the cleaning cloths out of the box and put it into the bag with the comforter. Use two sheets if you put the comforter directly into the dryer. Since the cloths are designed to be used with the bag, you’ll need the strength of two without the bag. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Stick the bag with comforter in the dryer.
steps.content: Stick the bag with comforter in the dryer. When the comforter and the cloth are in the bag, zip it shut and place it into the dryer. If your home dryer is not big enough to fit the comforter, take the bag to the laundromat to use the larger dryers available there. Don't force your comforter to fit into a too-small machine, because that can damage the comforter itself. [3] X Expert Source Safir Ali Professional Dry Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 September 2020.

steps.title: Tumble dry on medium heat for 30 minutes.
steps.content: Tumble dry on medium heat for 30 minutes. Set the dryer to medium heat. If your dryer has a timed setting, set it for 30 minutes. If your dryer does not have a timed setting, be sure to watch the clock or set a timer to ensure the comforter doesn’t dry for too long. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the comforter from the dryer and the bag.
steps.content: Remove the comforter from the dryer and the bag. When the dryer cycle has finished, remove the bag from the dryer and take the comforter out of the bag. If you put the comforter directly into the dryer, remove the comforter from it.

steps.title: Hang the comforter on a clothesline or railing to finish drying.
steps.content: Hang the comforter on a clothesline or railing to finish drying. After the cycle in the dryer, your comforter will most likely be damp from the cleaning. Hang the comforter on a clothesline, a railing, a shower curtain, or lay it on a couple of chairs so that it can air dry completely. [5] X Research source [6] X Expert Source Safir Ali Professional Dry Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 September 2020. Air drying prevents the inside of the comforter from either clumping up or knotting up. [7] X Expert Source Safir Ali Professional Dry Cleaner Expert Interview. 15 September 2020.

steps.title: Throw away the dry cleaning cloths and store the bag to reuse it.
steps.content: Throw away the dry cleaning cloths and store the bag to reuse it. Home dry cleaning cloths can only be used once, so throw them away in your trash. The bag is reusable, so store it with your other laundry supplies, and the box of unused cleaning cloths, for further use.

steps.title: Make an imitation home dry cleaning solution.
steps.content: Make an imitation home dry cleaning solution. Mix 1 cup (236.6 ml) warm water, 1 teaspoon (5 ml) borax, 1 teaspoon (5 ml) oxygen bleach and 3 drops lavender essential oil (optional, or use any other scent) in a bowl. Soak a washcloth in the mixture. Put the comforter and the wet washcloth into your dryer and dry for about 30 minutes. [8] X Research source This method does not “clean” a comforter, but gives a freshening effect similar to home dry cleaning kits.

steps.title: Use a steam cleaning system for light cleaning.
steps.content: Use a steam cleaning system for light cleaning. If your comforter is starting to get musty, treat it with a steam cleaner. Steam cleaners for clothes are filled with distilled water, which heats to steam. Run the steaming wand over the surface of the comforter to release bad odors and refresh the fabric. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Take your comforter to the dry cleaner.
steps.content: Take your comforter to the dry cleaner. If your dry clean only comforter is heavily soiled, a professional dry cleaner is your best option. Your other option is to wash it in the washing machine as you would any other garment or linen and hope that the comforter holds up to washing. Use cold water and low heat if you wash it at home.
